definition: disposition of troops/wave/spate/burst/spell/short period of time/classifier for events or states of short duration
-ly/structural particle: used before a verb or adjective, linking it to preceding modifying adverbial adjunct
to move one's base (of operations)/to reposition/to relocate

sentences.english: We broke through the border positions southwest of Kalwarya.
sentences.chinese: 我們突破了卡爾沃亞西南的邊境陣地。

sentences.english: The command post was set up in a forward position.
sentences.chinese: 指揮部設在前沿陣地上。

sentences.english: The enemy attacked in great numbers but our men stood their ground.
sentences.chinese: 敵人大舉進攻，但我方戰士仍堅守陣地。

sentences.english: The enemy attacked our foremost positions all night.
sentences.chinese: 整整一夜敵人攻打了我們的前沿陣地。

sentences.english: Burnside had thrown his army against Lee's defensive positions six times.
sentences.chinese: 伯恩賽德已經讓自己的部隊六次衝向李的防禦陣地了。

sentences.english: The scouts infiltrated into the enemy positions.
sentences.chinese: 偵察兵滲透到敵人陣地後面去了。

sentences.english: The decisive attack took off fromthe foremost position.
sentences.chinese: 決定性進攻是從最前沿陣地開始的。

sentences.english: With the move from manoeuvre to trench warfare, both the infantry and the artillery had to learn how to work together.
sentences.chinese: 由演習過渡到陣地戰，步兵和炮兵也需學會協同作戰。

sentences.english: They retired to safer positions behind the frontline.
sentences.chinese: 他們撤退到前線後面較安全的陣地。

sentences.english: During the night you re-deploy and dig the gun in.
sentences.chinese: 夜裏你除了重新佈置陣地還要挖炮位。

sentences.english: I think journalism is the last refuge for puns.
sentences.chinese: 我覺得新聞業是雙關語最後的陣地了。

sentences.english: Shells rained on the enemy position.
sentences.chinese: 炮彈像雨點般落在敵軍陣地上。

sentences.english: They peppered the enemys lines with their shots.
sentences.chinese: 他們用炮彈向敵人陣地密擊。

sentences.english: Their new outpost was on the crest of a hill.
sentences.chinese: 他們新的前哨陣地設在一座小山包頂上。

sentences.english: And even last year Plymouth lost less ground to Ford than did Chevrolet.
sentences.chinese: 即使在去年普利茅斯對福特喪失的陣地也比雪佛蘭少。

definition: to break a siege/to break out of an enclosure
to attack/to assault/to go on the offensive/attack/assault/offense (sports)
(military) strategic town/(fig.) major center (for commerce, culture or tourism etc)
war of resistance, especially the war against Japan (1937-1945)
